title: [ sand eater  ]
body:
sand eater
your grog lips grow
like the soles of your feet
wasted in grave apathy 

done the dunes
sultan of your nothing
dome the utterance
engraved in your turban

megalomaniac
flog your back
into crisp memory
until restored your countenance

title: [ rollercoaster  ]
body:
rollercoaster
all over hers
emotional at best
it was once invested
in pyrrhic returns
was it empirically sound?

or rationally found?
amidst your frown
rivers guide traitors
but in the grand landscape
of your form,
these are wise favours 
carved across your wrists

title: [ my beloved cherub  ]
body:
my beloved cherub
in your saint's rubble
the most putrid scent
curls your lips,
does it curb your faith

heard your late night wailings
within your mother's womb

i heard your temptation
unraveling a vixen's damnation

title: Cryptic currency
body:
I pay homage
See, current values
Do not hold liquidity
Or fold virility
Not mine, which is in duty
Wise impunity
Walking through
Brine and foam
I command these
Throne and tithe
In lingual figure
Cryptic currency
None specific
But it is live
I command it

title: canine dystasia
body:
strange cubs
in earth grown
hundred stone strong
in curse kindred
in silence howling
this evil incursion
that instills fear, stillborn
real bones,
neither globe domes
but drone lights flail the pipes
underneath
with the feeds

it is mine, alpine fantasia
canine dystasia

title: chariots
body:
Roman chariots
imbued these roads
in parallel paths reforced
this formative ideal
which concurs
with the personative idea
of one elastic aspiration
the arrogant confrontation
between man and God
about bequeathed judgements
surmises history,
promised lands,
messiahs and dormant kings,
from Sumeria to ethereal Avalon

heavens ignite
and burnt feathers rain
leveling granite paths
washing gravel roads
bleaching marble statues
but never the grand designs of fallen men

title: fugitive moon faces
body:
time cues in
prudence is reflected
in the fugitive moon faces
time is due
youth is loomed
with audacity and vivacity
in it retrospective of its own surroundings

likely a glimpse
a blimp of a slightly louder one
it learns to root 
before its turn is mute

notes get old
my wits do not get any bolder
I must hoist my pen
and catapult these thoughts

30, from here on I start to die
my sadness beckons into the material
and expressions stagnate into wrinkles
trickling bits of memory
the steep curve evidently flattens

30, from here on I start to lie
unlike before just in word
now in both worlds
when time denies the lux of reality
and delights become formality 

30, from here on I start to write
closer to the paper
entrusted to the strokes
I nurture on the past
and it pulses back

the dreamer dies, the poet is born

title: Lions of Judah
body:
weep not
behold
from the crown tomb of Abraham
ingrained gospels
and one refrained ramadan
in earth invested
these truths of heaven

enter the lions of Judah
stampede out those unforeign heathens
off the land of David
so that his star may burn unquestioned
lone victorious star, moonless
ruthless
truthless

earthly lords
of blood seeped land
in which they procure heaven
do find naught
but war and then blasphemy

title: [ May beacons  ]
body:
May beacons
from this to the next
in reflected oaths
credited goals
off the back of my unturned arcana

in my gruesome fealty
with no remorse to order
I've struck the utility of ghosts
as juxtaposed as just a stone
where rare critters roam under
in soul searching fables

with no recourse other than areality
to grasp the seeping eternity
off the extremeties of the cosmos

title: that 1984
body:
it was in 1984
that they killed my momma's soul
when my feet burned
in that basalt african soil
thorns in my throat
when I saw a fairy queen
shining before me
that oiled corpse
domed in petals colored white

it was in 1984 indeed
that codeine deemed intrinsic
when my lips chapped 
a flesh so rotten
in that house so silent
it was all that 
which felt so distant

it was that

my walking corpse, that was alive
in wretched contrast with a fairy Queen

title: [ it was beneath the hills  ]
body:
it was beneath the hills
of that antique Greece
that she let out the kings of the Republic
a myth distinctly real
that made this thryst uniquely royal 

it was not the paranoia, or the juvenoia 
that corrupted that pact
it was the olive trees
in liturgical rites of faith
alike the Huns before Thracia 
kneeled before the wooden token
there the urns of our forefathers
dismissed
unscripted off our history
with the heroes they crisped away
but the ash nostalgia stayed
deranged and flayed, 
now the devils of the hills

title: Vulgar Olga
body:
evil Olga
perhaps had it prefaced 
in a world of strange things
where night wisps
don't seem so vulgar

evil, Olga, you are evil
was it your body or his?
well, after all
dismembered words
are so cold
in the folds of your torn dress
where he lived his toils

Olga, don't be so verbose
as no bigger noun thrived
not in these sour Mediterranean plains
where olive trees protect our innocence
beneath these lazy afternoon shades
that only you could outshine

title: [ knit onion rings  ]
body:
knit onion rings
my briefly wed vampires
transpire into my night trades
say, did you extract his bile?
that which is essential
for the concotion which is superterrestrial
in all notions, poison, distortion
in the skin, corrosion, sexually potent
that risen vice

my written rites expired
when that pen fell mute
no dispute
he set foot and put cues
it was she, the muse
that laid bloody stakes 
through his ribcage

stale and distastefully grazed
by a tragedy dry of any romance

title: ego trip
body:
forget the Nubian seed
desist the crown
before it sees you
undress that royal garb
unspill this
bond which you do not have
braids which you do not own
before it shames you
they'll find you
creeping in the night
machete in hand
the congolese have lynched closer neighbors
than the transatlantic stranger you've become

be at ease
before someone, you are no one
when they sailed you off, hands in shackles
ego strip
but now watch how they say it
"ego trip"

title: The Grand Inquisitor: Reprise
body:
pardoned ghosts
all these fiery boats
rationed bowls
for he who was and still is
in that image erect
out his tomb and fumes
with clues of eternity
for he his eternal
in all that we are infirm
as in after the fact, after the pact
for that heavenly bread
which in nothing is earthly
but everything before and after is

so it is to thee and not he
earthly, pagan, profane and perverse gods
that I offer this fiery boat
so that we earthly, pagan, profane and perverse sinners may live before we die and not after

title: fairies
body:
doctor, have you lifted my liver
with a stiff touch, if you please
indistinct from that of death
see, I've produced it from my guts
this fear whose spirit I've distilled
into the base components of hypocrisy
I've mastered it in secret
this act, this domain of cynical despair
do you not trust me?

while the starving fairies circled my corpse
I gave them a sight most appetising
there it was, in vivid imagery
the riddle that rippled their wings

title: [ falling clothes  ]
body:
falling clothes
all my soiled virgins
undisclosed, tail my toes
marble tiles, and bubbled sights
one of those caught my eye
in a putrid scent, animals
in a lovely sense, water falls
and sea foam, they subvert the bolt
seize my cross and bow, tie and dice
oh these bloodless plays
are the bloodiest of all to their skirts

title: galleys
body:
yes I do rob the stalls
I cash the lots
scratch the price and roll in dirt
disguise the product
I am the roth, the child
and the holy spirit
solely folly
I am the blood clot
if do trace back,
i am very much the only sot
with a rich flannel
and morrow crops
sold in galleys

title: olive trees
body:
oh no
my olive trees
diseasoned 
host these shades
inflated states of gray
my ego nation
disease stricken
casts no forms

other than strung 
I am shrunk
beneath my
imprisoned by
my olive trees

title: virgins of the praerie
body:
these mad boars
done chased the babes off the praerie
betrothen tools, these fools lack providence
their virgins deprived of the touch of God
they will see
no Mary will synthesize amidst their tribes
and find path in the sands' immortal coffin

open their tombs, sovereign pigs
then their wombs, solemn kings
albeit silenced, evil still reeks
in those most innocent
hunger for loaves 
grows into angery growl

title: Silence, Abstinence
body:
the akkadian's agency
shortsighted its lunacy
but I, a deeply seated regent
number the pages of my diary
with cyrillic mysteries 
truthly abstinent, 
I have hid the consequence

do my excuses
ever fool my tools
that I might ink a thought,
without a word of proof,
in it to truncate a shameful play?

I drink my numbers
in a shot of old silence

title: Saint John's Nickels
body:
my darling
these funeral listings
have colors of their own
selfish graves and their loans
numbers scratched and corrected
your grief pays more debt than homage
until you shift the hourglass
and the sands reveal a body

a corpse whose wounds are scabbed by counterfeit Saint John's nickels

title: psychotic bulls and etc
body:
when the onus wavered
I had the inspirational quorum,
then erratically brigaded and jaded,
introspect in the thematic prison
a primordial pool that spread in full
I see these bulls
these devilish fiends 
scene by scene
then the cassette rerolls 
and I have the full script
to the foreign cult,
and the solo act that sells its voice

I go on believing ghosts
souls and otherworldly stories
because only then I have ink in my storage

title: a kind of aggressive litany
body:
they devoured my mother
in the womb's cruel dark
I probed the coal mine
before I stole the diamonds
and told her I despised her in full
my solo praxis 
the trident, the chalice
unbeknownst to me, all the regalia
it was I, a child, who held a warchest
not the time, or the treaty
a kind of aggressive litany

title: the virtuous butcher storms the parliament
body:
make face, tribune 
with he who says grace
in light of that terror
that colours the venues white
the violent strides
of deranged blades
in some days, decapitated

the deaminated revolution
now demands its own Napoleon
a wry triumf 
but a sly tribute
to he who claims virtue
despite that terror

title: but don't you see? I've been breathless all along!
body:
unease 
in any case
amiss in the wheat fields
shopping carts without bars
it is a race for the buccaneers
faceless and breathless however
the line never ends
and no one is left to chart the continent
row and row
and yet no soil
row and row
no anchor set

title: blind man combo
body:
i have it stated
written down, painted
i take off my skin and lace it
in prism i see the light
the seismic arrangements of the rings
the most internal outsourced paradigms
the anecdotes
the sillables and their paralels
the paradox
i find the enemy
in a storm of salt
that flattens the sight
i am then blind, but god forgive us
the world is all darkness

title: suburban practices
body:
we can go 
in stop motion
pick up the big guns
and let the bulls roam
lovely pictures of death
are yet a discouraging love story
so we find time
recess, exercise, make friends at best
then go back in crude expression

it's a subtle
but very suburban practice
fascist perhaps
but I trust you're on your way too

title: baseball boys
body:
sure strike face
I wear different stripes
different shoelace shades 
I'm into boys
who play baseball games
I don't walk, I glide
but I might
if I'm not too shy
a step at a time
I weight my shoes
with care
as you should
handle me with flair
sprinkles, tea and Louvre
in layman's terms
I'm as proud as it gets
a blunt arrow too much fletched

title: the fourth
body:
it is
the wake of the fourth
come
come now
let's harvest the children 
scythe the chords
set free the pups
and light the doors
don't you see
we too are the men of God
by the fluke in our times
and the dice in the pubs
the flue has been cast
lord in heaven almighty
if it is truly you 
unmount thy beast 
and do feast with us

because we too are the men of God

title: it's a boar's world
body:
there's a quote
around my ropes
a boar struck with a loathsome frown
it's not the kind of death
you live through
it doesn't sit well
with the wine or the guilt 
I have nothing to lose
it's not an excuse,
it's not a ruse, it's a tilted window 
soon I'll be there
under no illusions
no intrusions
just my suddenly burnt flesh 
sat at my desk, with my legs crossed,
my glasses set aside, 
my charred lips,
at a loss of words
"oh look, all that was mine"

title: trash
body:
I have lit the wound
like big boot sluts
in a way I proof tool
the truth before it's spewed 
I'm a two horse wagon
and I'm am at it with the vision
see I'm abandoned in the attic
my lady's got a television
and we fuck to the static
it's like madness, it's the right presence and the perfect absence

you wouldn't sit through
but they have Sanders 
in a grudge, in a stool, they tell me to loot my corpse before it's too-

title: mobility, nobility, alacrity
body:
in the midst of the clicks
and the clacks
we run off and go
shoot up the peas
behind the factory
the machinery works up
behind our backs, and it forms
however coincidentally
a soundtrack to our negligence
oh me and you, we'll be but reveries
in a most morose way, and evidently so
we can afford to waste away
leech away our last throes

behind our backs,
there it grows slowly but in full throttled diligence
the new nobility

title: [ the crab mobsters  ]
body:
the crab mobsters
who run the jewels
of sublime ukraine
in alleys white
of fear red and numbered signs
the sights provided
prophecies and whatnot
embelish whatever's left
when they let fall the shells

when they let call the bells
you let fall the beak
or perish thy soul
in a parish that is a court
to a sword that is all ecclesiastical

title: Katya
body:
you know, I
I meant
Katherine the Wheel
like Catherine the Real
from heels to her buns
you know how she
used to sell her charms 
in stealth, as in leaps
as she then hopped
on disgrace as much as in grace
oh she was a Bourbon
one neither French or Portuguese
you know
russian caliber with a palette for irony
and a skin resistant to stone
but always prone to loan
more than I should hold

hare in distance
a fair trade to my fantasies

title: catherine
body:
marshland panic
do you hear, oh what remedy?
thunderbolt motives
to the minotaurs
the calendar centaurs
whoever stargazes
when your first is born
in a turn you go, then a ghost is born 
Catherine the wheel, of fate
and of a putrid taste for comedy
in neither way God
in every way: death

title: Irene The Greek
body:
i beseech
how i seek
my drink
in my sleep
my seasoned pleas
to my reasoned fears
you hold me in your limbo
and loath me in my treason

title: no mystery, no misery
body:
is it such a mystery?
the manner how
the wrinkles in my dress
form a spectacle
a sabbath at it
how a liberal is radicalised
and towed up the Alps
then told "Behold, Ultramontane!"
alas, the folds coat no secrecy
it is so
that cotton and silk
are not as humane 
as a sword and a pouch

a stout statement, or the silverine dove

title: [ here  ]
body:
here
it's a poetry book
or a music book
something of sorts
mostly moss
wore out pages
that's it alright 
sooner a philosopher's gimmick
than a man's ludic
it is a loss so far
beneath your virgin rays
it satiates, it drains,
from and through
your cognitive trade

title: have you heard? they sell pigs at the morgue
body:
morgue
surveyed, enforced
I hold no remorse
because I'm a whore and I know it
derranged, estranged
I feel it when I bid it
and I esteem it
and you know that I need it
so I greet with all my limbs split
rid it all of pigment
fill the bracket with security
like spread pigs on the pavement
yeah I'm here for the digits 
you know, community market 
place yours, I always place mine
a quick spliff

title: [ 404 canyon   ]
body:
404 canyon 
medallion, I've got mine
turd in mud but I stride right
third in line alright
but I have the thirst
to wait beyond the denial of service
you know,
she's the kind the of girl
who'll ride no less than a stallion
you know,
she signed my files but then logged off
sawed off my extension cord
and the whore stormed off
I mean fuck no
I need it
I can't, I'll steal it
I mean it when I say I'll steer it
no it's not about me,
I just empathize with
all of my seven eyes

numbers aside
I might just
find a price, tag it and bag it
net the amazoness in action
have her streak the rubrics off the asterisks

title: rock paper shotgun
body:
lead brain
shotgun, paper, big game
I'm a big girl, with long braids
sit straight
where would you rather be dear?
third base
will you remove my teeth braces 
before you kill me babe?

say you will
say you did
book me a flight
use me until I'm flat 
and if you dare
noose me a gasp

title: Elizabeth
body:
vivacity at least
in the libraries 
if we yet sleep
in-between just these verses 
reaffirming each other 
entertaining a summit
as the leaves kiss the summer and wither
leaving behind no debrief
just the ellipsis

but oh if you'd wager
to dream another page 
in this despondent tragedy
another feast in solace
enthroned in this palace
it is I, my love, your paladin!
would you not obtain
if not peace, another wish 
let be, your wisp that still lives
enthralled, my Alice 

come wither 
in your dress, and in your death
let the chalice drink,
from the abyss

title: [ find yourself in relay  ]
body:
find yourself in relay
it's not your war
but it hits close home doesn't it?
old heads chant
as syrens bid the warhead welcome 
how come?
our kosovar Moses
bears no coat of arms
your story will not be told!
and it will hit you slowly 
that all this might just be your calling
a greater science
to depose the alliances
except this time 
the war is yours
your foes no longer none
the hands that quivered 
become those that write
as much terror as history
so goes the irony
that you hold yourself in quite a praise

title: stuntman combo
body:
dismembered figurines
suitcase repository
dragged out in no more than rags
fared no better than the senate 
"parliament is hereby dissolved"
he said
well suit yourself Charles
if you had no stars
your chest would be charred
an Ark to your Joanne per say
and your ashes but the side exhibit
in the lesser days at the Louvre

no conscience too graced
of the mistake that too late relates

title: [ double Caesar   ]
body:
double Caesar 
cash cab and dash
fast attest the vast
marsh empyrean
how they peek
oh my Euclid 
if you're mine
do close the lid
and press my form 
hide the ink beneath my skin
enforced distortion
it burns, it burns
megalithic saviour
megalomaniac 
pyromaniac

title: [ melt away   ]
body:
melt away 
oh melt away
heaven's grace to belic race 
the earth burns and crumbles
as if God in slumber
the end of times
starts in kind
not with the the taking of lives 
but with the blurring of lines

title: [ canonised guilt  ]
body:
canonised guilt
babygirl we're history
leave it to me 
I got the entropy
the centipede 
tailing, I'm talking ancestry
whatever's ailing
sailing, african aid in waiting
powder for power 
in change of which was never really yours
but now is truly ours 
and so are your ruly hours 
now

don't wanna hear about it
my token black doesn't wanna talk about it
forget about it

title: R.a.I.D.
body:
come on now your honor
i didn't promise them asylum
they chose their own death
if they starved, i was but a bystander
with a straight understanding
of a social merit
that i conquered but they relinquished
call me vicious then
but i didn't promise a thing
your honor
i made the home they stole from me
the gas chamber that'd steal their lives from them
i heard them scream or i dreamt i heard them scream
but i sure saw them quiver
when opened the heavy door
some pretended to be dead
but a man is no fool
i burned their weakened bodies
the young and old
crisped their souls off their vessels
until they were but a block of black 

and just like that my kitchen was free of flies

title: asphalt
body:
converse the few
in a church or in destruction
as far as impersonal
courage is never brought up
unless we're in court 
on what grounds
is it found
have you heard?
a body in Prague 
a post modern pogrom
are you pro-death or a strawman?

asphalt all stark
how will our crimes
yet appall our past

title: death attunement
body:
understand
me and death play games
tame the fast lane
like Tamerlane 
in the way how
a pyramid was the center piece
of a thousand tragedies 

I think of 
the cycles in which our crops mock
the lines in which our lives flock 
while valiant cells fight entrenched
as they fight as they have fought
I conclude a most chalant feature
in the curvatures and attitudes of the formless 
I attune then
to a sexualised impression
of my own premeditated-
oh, I've missed it

title: the guillotine shatters Versailles and flies scatter leaving behind only their lord
body:
but you have a misled train
of thoughts and misery 
unpurposed array of trays
lined up in a way...
have you supposed
your hands untainted?
light up to a prey
left a man with no face
and a body with no shade
the antler paraded atop the lake,
as the swan's song played,
merely framed aside 
whereas you would have surely come to my aid

aged upon
my faith that is wronged
even so the sacrilegious gong will dull on

title: Konstantinos
body:
machiavellian
para bellum 
sand castles
in the age of essence?
to the extent
of too much expense
for a crumbling message
a singular passage
in the misunderstood sentence
of the mistranslated text
oh does it pass the test of time?
in hindsight none of us do
orwellian noose
and a stoop too low
we grow out of god's grace
prefacing our doom 
yet at the edge of Thrace
we engage eternity

title: [ wrench in my plans  ]
body:
wrench in my plans
band in a stance
has a boy in a ploy 
to overthrow, toy and destroy 
troy in the cereal box
ox beef indistinct from greens
ill greens, olive set beans
unease, unease, unease
I cease to exist and feel it up my sleeves

distant plea
I cease to exist

title: mega naga death
body:
fruits in mist an all
I ain't got a clue but
I hear them slither
a fluke or a flute
hindu priests
on the move to loot my corpse
serpents dance

surfer's trance
pounce a dyson
and crash the wave
a thousand bysons
atop a frightened lion
you see why 
you plight my vial?

right?
how you know how I do it
when I do it like I do it
mixed up in a stew
two drops from the brew
all in all
prove that I don't need a proof

title: it was mine all along
body:
all the while 
I've been in southern Wales 
watching, waiting 
for the verse to fall and stale 
if it is dated, it is fated
fatally so, 
as much as the next Roman that is holy 
or the next folly that is German 

alas the roads are paved
so to Rome I haste 
with each death I renew my claim
and raid my rays through the chapel's panels
as strange as great 
i displace and take
because it was mine all along

title: transcosmic obliteration lux
body:
chlorophyll?
ingestion
a jester's defection
that deduced a spruce off the tundra
a master's umbrage...
in a moon he lost northumbria
throttling the pedal off his wheel
paramount, or paranoid, or a stoic paragraph
in the life of the xenomorph 
without a mold
no outpost
no outgrow
just radioactive glow.

automobile?
yes, congestion

title: The snow capped aqueducts run crimson
body:
dock the canoe
stock and lock
(just in season)
probe and sort
the attributes
collect your dues and redistribute
trickle, sickle, little russian pickle
even the snow capped aqueducts run crimson

nonetheless, embarked
regardless, a tale of monarchs
deposed yours,
repurposed the throne,
and now the snow capped aqueducts run crimson

title: Starlink Expresso
body:
If I could dream of my death
Like I dream of my heartbreaks
I'd have nothing, except for my ribcage
My shades, my trays
Cafeteria in space
Inadequately advertised
To pressure our children onto compromise
Thankfully I'm exempt of the brick cage
If the pigs come after me 
I'll tell them it's for self defence
See how they lace round my pits
Thorough my grid
From my seed to my sprouts
I'm the sea and the night
For my stranded thoughts

But if you see right through the bullet hole...

title: Philip
body:
You must know 
Of a strange that is evil
In it dismissive of anything but faith
Ages in decades of decadence
A precedent that blockades all pages
In history, in victory
That writer that sits in Paris
That one, for the poet's misfortune
Wields both the pen and the sword

But oh Philip, must you go?
Saladin is in city 
Death decreed and all
Lion's heart abandoned
And a German's body floats down the Saleph

title: [ There's a fire in Alexandria  ]
body:
There's a fire in Alexandria
The ptolomies preach Mazda
As it is, soon it will be
That all that remains are ghosts
Ghosts that are neither gods or messiahs
It is either one or another one of the same colour 
Of course you can't disgrace the lion's mane
But you can dye it black and call it Sharia

As there were crusader tents outside Jerusalem
As there were stranger ships outside the city of Saint Constantine
There will always be death 
Just outside the temple of your most holy ghost

title: [ Estrogen   ]
body:
Estrogen

Estrogen

title: I see
body:
But I lie

With my seatbelt on

body: just kidding kill me but no, for real kill me kill me before i do it'll make it easier because i'm weaker kill me before i make a step towards another painful mess skin my mask off reel my neck off give me that medicinal headshot yo, i'm not sad, i'm just stressed, my thoughts been following me like a goddamn midnight mugger, and i forgot my way home, of fuck it, what home? we're one with the song many with the words a hundred psychiatric wards inside my head, i forget to check and they'll stack my debt let me rest before i do it'll make it easier because i'm eager to let it-

title: quicksand joy and other screeches
body:
Awoken
With a dagger in my heart
Familiar fingerprints
Of a known culprit

Where have I been?




Then

Welcome to the crime scene
My dreams in bubbles
My sins in steel
The bells are subtle
But they too laugh

Ahah
No pity of me
I've sunk in another's blood
Long before
In my own quicksand

(I bleed, oh I bleed, how long until I dry?)

title: the 'interweb'
body:
here where we hide
we built this little pulp fiction of ours
soon enough a fly is bound to fall
and, to his surprise
find himself more at home than at loss

but tho comfortable at times, one can never rest
that spider is the one unseen but felt demon
that one that breeds our evil

title: sunflowers
body:
it is like
sunflowers blooming in winter
it is like a breeze before midday's supper
all around me 
like a leash, on my killing
could it be? a sign of hope?
(or perhaps...the hangman's rope?)
(i don't really wanna know)

but i really wanna go
out in the fields
with her words drowning
my inner creaks
oh take me out
and i'll

i'll hold on to your force

it is like sunsprout
before my dark
you're thus my god
down my guard

title: 'i'm gonna do it for real'
body:
i found him shooting blanks in the woods
scaring the other birds with his bursts
saying he was gonna do it
"i'm gonna do it"
there's already...too much blood in the tree

you'll end up dead in the streets
if they end up finding you

have you ever seen a bird in the streets?
you've never even shot a tree
you found it neat and proceeded with the beating sounds
"i'm gonna do it for real"
you're the lying kind
but nevermind
after all i hold the key
and you're just another part of me

title: thinking about it
body:
i guess that's the truth
i mistook my heart for another ruse
killed it before it bloomed

yeah and now i'm shook
because i'm no more certain
of what i felt back then

no more certain 
of what rules to comply with you

body:
these nights are for killing
and you know it because
you're always the first killer
and it's all fine
it's all right
all's great
cuz after all
we're just kids
just kidding

these nights are for nice things
a fancier ball
than a wider fall
dancing with our tiptoes
because we make it justice
after all we just met

after all 
we just met

courses and rehearsals
talking with you is morse code

provoking
all's provoking
but after all
we just met

title: rain dance
body:
Wading pain
Fading and waking
Victim of a thousand feints
I know what I made in gold coins
But does she know what she paid to the boatman?
Styx and stiffened bedrock
Rock with the starts
You're not even confused
Because there you commute your reason
To some other mission that only you know of

Wander and stunt down another man
It is all, I guess
Just a rain dance
Whatever falls, it is on you to blame

body:

stuck in my head?

go out of my way

title: sameness
body:
purple deaths before friday
just don't feel right
what is it, your kind of murder?
i'm stuck in the sameness jen has spoke of...
i'm thinking of some folklore
i'm thinking of some false hopes
a game with a stale goal
yeah i could spice it up
yeah i know but i don't know
because i'm always home and all i know is the walls and the lucky holes in the soil
in the prison i've grown acquainted with

then i'm a saint
because i'm always strange to that evil...
it thinks of things beyond me
i can only dream to piece his feats
and find peace in cheaper words
-that's my apology
-what's your apology?

dream diary

dream diary

title: sei que sou
body:
sei que sou
pelo que fui
e pelo que fiz
pelo que matei
e pelo que chorei
sei que sonho e sei que vivo
mas no sei se rio ou finjo
porque sinto e preciso ao mesmo tempo

horrenda sei que  a senda que me governa
se bem que me  estranha
aquela que me protege e serve de inspirao

ento, assim sei, senhores e senhoras do juri
que sou inocente, da noite at a poesia

title: this world we live in
body:
this world we live in
this wilderness disguised
this home entrusted to the ideal
hidden, under, a dream
this force, this form of comfort

this world we bleed in
a ring of killers and whisperers
whichever kills me first
i'm here with a gun in my hand
tho blind till it takes me

this world we trust in
who do we trust in?
when the world crumbles
who do we ask for protection?
when bullets rain from the skies

title: that one night i slept with the pelican
body:
i slept with this pelican i just met
under his wings and the ten bottles of rum,
atop his crap infested nest,
i sent a query to the nightly stars
to which they found me impertinent, 
treacherous adulterous

to this my companion awoke
i feared this, he questioned me
who had i been talking to
he shouted and spread his wings wide
menacing
the pelican stroke and choked me
then he told me:

"beware the cosmopolitan vampire
redefining the bonfire
watch me fly or scatter
understand, pretend, or find a deadlier poison"

then he flew away and never came back

title: i hate myself, why don't you hate me too?
body:
down on my neck
because i hate myself
why don't you hate me too?
a lost fuse with the few
a wrapped virus in pink
ticking till it blooms
killing till it dooms my friends and my hopes
am a wrong and a flaw
a sickening thorn in that bush

here i go again
how does it feel?
how can i feel so?
on board to risk you and this mess of a bond

title: Xxxx
body:
So it feels
XXXX is the flare
A stare or the nightmare
The good haven or the sentence
The pretense is of a memory lapse
Of a lost youth that never occurred

She's indeed, it feels
The morning wake of the shrieking feeling of change and danger

She is, however
Merely a child in the larger flame
Burning light
Igniting might
Writing signs and making wife as she walks

body:
i wish i could wake up with my hands tied
my dreams wrapped against the walls
my blankets tore apart
and the bed stained with demon blood

there i'd see to it before it consumed me
my eyes twinkle

body:

talks with signs,

she's this kind of woman
cold, dark but watching with one eye at a time

title: A fuga de uma emoo
body:
H
Uma procura
A fuga de uma emoo
E a ascenso  palavra

Haver, de certo modo
Um grito eufrico
Que se transformar em poesia
Assim, a semente de tal alegoria 

Havero, porventura
Portas que abriro sem chaves
Figurando um estilo, 
Dando a vida  lrica
Desvendando um mistrio
Pela fora de um outro

Seguindo
Ruas curvas, ou retas, talvez turvas por vezes
Interconectando fantasias, abrindo teorias
Havers ento de conhecer a fugitiva, nua e perdida
Ali, e s ali, sers o que sois em sonho
Um arquiteto e o profeta de algo interno

Ali, havers ento de saber
Que s em sonho somos realmente poetas

title: under a hundred sunsets
body:
we did this on a sunday
we dreamt of this place
a beach at the abstract planet
banked by godspilt blood 
we went and fenced the sand
honed it ours...

i wore black
you wore purple
i said hold, you undressed
-then we had sex 
(on the beach)
under a hundred sunsets
you let it sink in (you always do)

you let it reel in
you couldn't blame me
you sought the feeling
and i provided 

this you know,
that we signed the suspicious book,
with our names in red
here sold, what we had left
and then fed, on the surplus?

is it a sentence? or just a coincidence?

salem girls, salem girls

salem girls

tell me all

body:
my leather shoes 
don't last long
i go out in the fields with my bow tie on
black over white
a bottle of wine between these finer sheets
stains round the fame
never round my shame
i don't go out with my hat on
so it rivers down
(my flair is on my flat style
i got nothing to hide because the dress bears it all)
the sun so tries
but never dries the sweat 
never before it waters the flames

title: se-re-ni-ty
body:
she's energy
she's my therapy
the counterpart of my synergy

writing my name on the walls
and checking my veins every fall
se-re-ni-ty
clarity and brutality
when she sees me, she sees me
she needs me and she'll kill me
before i see it
because she'll call me and i'll come
numb to the routine

title: my friend's in love
body:
my friend's bewitched

she manned down 
the sandman
broke down a nineteen storey spree
woke up in another story

she told me,

she told me she's entwined
confined in her mind
concerning the after-flight
she took without a light

my friend's in love

a first born love with the surreal figure
shining in bright armor 
so much!
~stretching 
~to the evil figure

oh my friend's conflicted
she worries she's from another cattle
from...
a far away castle

and oh i know, i know, i know, lord knows i know
she's home because she knows i know

title: a poem to the gods
body:
table flips
backward page flips
we're paraphrasing phrase tricks
in between paintbrush strokes 
running from the hangman
for the thrill
falling in love
for the feel
fishing wishes at every comet
sick men and women
drunk in the mind
and in the spawn of it

this you will not take

why do you insist?

the art is not offered - it is found
the experience is not spoken - it is felt

you will not rulebook me
you will not make an engineer out of me

here
i toast to myself
because i express myself with my heart 
and not with a manual

There's blood

body:
You could throw the dice

title: Who does god pray to?
body:
I do look at the night sky
As dark as mysterious
Picture it bright off all of the stars
Brushing off my insignificant loneliness
There my life makes it to another light
One that illuminates all that is true and righteous
And so do I see by this doming light
At the bedside mirror
The reflection of me
Of me who is in his image made
And as I pray, there it comes to me
Who does He
The blurry reflection of me
Pray to
On these lonely nights

body:

And these are silken sins

Bleach your eyes
Hold up on the lease

Do nest as you see it fit
Where you see fit
Maybe at the spring break bloom
Where the petals fell

Who can tell?
No one can tell

You had sex in the church
And silenced a priest
With a dagger at his throat

title: Diomedes' Satire | We can't kill gods
body:
Fake your death
FLASH!

By the fire, one diamond
Lightless shine
Finally, there is reply
But inside your dark...
But, question it,
by chance, unlock the mind

there there child
this is power
and this is how

say "Open Sesame"
sky scratching thoughts
flock to your gates
here to your heed,
as they, finally, kneel before your will
born from, and borne out by
~a certain creed
to breed profane deeds
a kid
is
no more
under true sun-dawn

but come on now friend
we can't kill gods
but we can maybe fly too...if we try

this
is satire

(a goddess curves to scratch her bosom)

you don't fight the fight for a doomed kingdom
you step back and enjoy the sight

while you can

title: Chant
body:
here i lay
in the grave i dug
stuck fast with the whimpering voices
at last at peace and at last brimming
with certainty

here i lay
if i so may

here i lay
alive but numb
to pain and sunder
woke in slumber
when not in wonder

here do i lay
as i so well may
as even if a stray
were to warm the face
still i'd be all
but lonely

so i here lay
and here i chant
under silent hums
by hushed lips
naively baiting
my beyond lady

no no no momma

no
oh no no no no

momma please understand

all day

title: Eyes deep beneath the debris
body:
They're on to me

The divine hand fell on me
Leveled the mind
Thus stuck my time at this dream

At this flattened land
I am the stone under hundred degrees to my brethren
Hidden deep
Deep beneath debris
Piercing eyes lashing tight
Rashing my wounds
Stretching my looms

title: I do want to set the world on fire
body:
She said
"Can you unveil the magic trick within my grace?"
She set the veil down her face
And then slipped
Through his fingers
Sweet illusion that he ever had her
But the pursuer is never staggered
Neither by winds or sins of his whims
She dangled, he ran after the left trail of a dense sense of heavenly presence

So he pivoted to the pretense
And ravaged through countless domains of the moral
She crossed mountains, he shattered mountains
A childish walk in the forest bloodied the flowers
A whispered secret killed a priest
And then when she danced
He sang:

"I do want to set the world on fire
I want to spark the dark in my heart"

title: To: Chester
body:
Chester,

It pains me to write
And it pains me to know you wont know
Of the pain on my chest
A play on your name
Is to pop a needed smile at this time
To give me strength to keep writing this memory
So in the future I can look back at the pain your death has caused
So I can never forget what your voice
What your words
And the absence
Have meant to me

It pains me
Because I did not get the chance to know you
Because I could not thank you for the escape provided
From a life that suffocated and no
No
No
No.
It wont compensate if I rationalize
Because it has been weighted
And it seems your presence is what I truly absorbed from Linkin Park

I will not cry
Why?
This strange form of pain is new to me
And that pains me
And I wish I could tell you
And thank you
For what youre teaching me right now
I just wish I could tell you

But I wont
And you wont know either
Because youre dead
And that pains me

title: The Art of Emotion and Image
body:
The poet is no storyteller,
So, I can assure you
As far as you're concerned
That there is no cryptic message behind my words.
It is
What you can see AND feel
And that, dear dreamer
Is up to you.
The poet, if anything, is a painter
Who uses words instead of paint
As such each stroke is only essential as long as it remains in the piece
As such dismantling the composition is an act of vandalization

As far as you're concerned, it is not about me.
It is what you can see and feel
Whatever it may be
As varying as it may be
Because that's how it should be
The piece is to invoke emotion and image
Out of us
Both the poet and the reader
Leading us to a better understanding of our selves

This, at least, is the kind of poetry I so dearly enjoy to read and write

body: The voice tells me: "hell the sky has swallowed our heroes stand down stand atop the ice cube upside down on your tiptoes and push the dark seed, pull the sweet mead drank sank morning blank close the robe, check the rope stretch your toes hey you know why stay saint with enough holy water you would not feel the mocking flames hey replace the label and refill the bottle round two go! OH LOSE'EM ON YOUR NIGHTLY DANCE FEEL THE TRANCE LOSE'EM BECAUSE YOU SAID FEEL THE TRANCE LOSE'EM OH BROTHER MAKE'EM ALL DANCE TO YOUR SONG but before long you're awake and the ice is thinner if you could only run away..."

title: Wasp
body:
off with the tide
find a door, break it down
a bang is sure to widen an eye or two
make it sting like a wasp
to spring the string
and crown the king

hello hello, devil lord
am here for a refund
this brash son of yours has yet to learn

how much to get back my unappreciated identity?

title: Scyphae
body:
the illusion is the bomb's clock
the truth is i have complete control over it
the delusion however is my deliberate ignorance
i have shut my eyes and clogged my ears with whispered fears
oh i don't wanna think about it
i don't wanna know what it means
and i don't wanna know what the consequences are
for all we know
i won't be alive to face them
the consequences
and their faces
when they realize this one's true face

the tide is calm
i might as well let it be

title: Frija
body:
what shadow is pulling the string
before the projected image of uncertainty
what emotion is he prying on?
my presence is debatable - is it not?
where am i - what am i
when lacking freedom to not be
when scarcely aware of what it means
when barely attached by a weak string

the current tide is serene
i might as well let it be

title: Tick tock, bleep blop, rest in peace
body:
Tick tock

Strange time loops

Twisting shape

Breaching logic

Far ahead

Pretty escapades from sleepless evenings

By the hermit's lodge

Suggestive glimpses of a childish god

Tick tock
Bleep blop

And just like that

You're here
And then you're not

Where or when
Does it all
Connect?

title: Celestial Rage
body:
It will come to you
That by the time you realize
The hidden compromise
Truth will be
Seen through scalding skies

For those yet with prideful eyes
Watch your step
Watch and fret
For your son, and grandsons
Be warned
For your kind
As you will before I
Face celestial rage

tracked and locked

pretty girls

body: It feels like a spring relief When I'm free to be at your side and reside at your mercy ~the ice cream drops on your chest the tight gaps between your naked legs the subtle sensuality within your gestures~ The wondrous feeling of safety amidst your mystery Because there's nothing to know Because there's nowhere to go You've made my home right where you sit -At the start of the stairs to my lust

something
something
something

and oh

far 
far
far

title: HS | pilgrimage #12 [END]
body:
got my black suit
my ocean blue bowtie
my dark sights

my brother sleeps
by my side
the devil is sweet once asleep
hes so weak isn't he?




i've caught the fast train
moving through my line of fair earned pain
we hope to get to church by sundawn
there we may repent for every sin
and clear path for the upcoming sacrifices


i think not
of going back
to that neat sunny garden
where she could, maybe, be waiting in a shining white dress dancing by the wind's touch
as i wished her to
discipline is not discipline if not permanent


i am still the same
what has changed is perhaps the presence of fear and the absence of SELF
did i expect the magic turn of worlds
but all things considered
i am but an wannabe poet who falls to cheap rhymes


oh
my brother smiles in his sleep


no
i'm no poet

title: WILL | pilgrimage #11
body:
my sword is starforged
and my power is will sourced
slicing hacking
probing my flesh
frenzying brash 
mindless wreck
shrieking cold blooded
but sticking to the melody
there's still some law in my dance routine
unforeseen
you haven't seen my true face have you?
you're not my real consciousness are you?
what a puny being
expected something...
frightening
but it seems you're still me
what a weakling
your voice is toxic
always that same elusive tonic
you can trigger my Hyde and you can even stain my pride
but you will never stop my fight

i'm a lonely man waiting in line at the purgatory
as you say
my time is due
but my lives are infinite
and i plan to walk this lie for as long as i can be myself 
i'll make you watch
all of it
it is your turn
to sit back and whine

i'm in command now

title: peak | pilgrimage #10
body:
the wind here
is sharper
a wail in determination
and your skin is lit
there are nymphs and imps
swimming around
each for each
free to pick
easy to reel them in
but the wind is sharp at the peak of strength
each step is leading me closer to my enemy and to my death

but then i walk down to cross the river

akin grinning faces
lacing tight my heart
pulling at all sides
but do i suffocate?
am a dead man walking
i already hear the old scythemans knocking
you're all crawling stalking a man on his feet

now i know where you are
the view has betrayed and spilled out where you leech out
demon i'm coming for you

title: for me and for them | pilgrimage #9
body:
happy days feel like ominous omens
merciful gifts from the playful gods before the storm
no matter how true these shine

i can't bring myself to dine with my weapons sheathed
i've learned against my will to kill any will that presents itself queer to my heart on these days

see
i smile with bloody jaws
above erected paws
broader arms rawer dark
i'm a louder cannibal on sunnier days
the fear
rises to horror and fuels my power

all flocks to the gates of my core
until the final supernova
a scream of relief echoes in the outer world
and a voice is sodomized in the inside

but
you are unharmed

a madman's sacrifice

for me and for them
for me and for them
for me and for them
i wail
for me and for them
i walk 
for me and for them

title: assembly | pilgrimage #8
body:
there's a waterfall near my world's end
where all thoughts eventually meet
each string, each stream, each sin
all converge into a singular motionless lake
how serene is our death
how serene is the inner bath
i wash away all my doubt and lavish myself in spiritual enlightenment

i truly feel as the king of my kingdom
for before reaching peace
they all comes to attend he who amends
each node awoken and spoken out 
of a known potent liar's wrath

oh my rightly subjects
we do not vacillate before the fake monarch
it may come to us before courage comes to us
we step on before we're stepped on
and for that
i must sacrifice
hoping that will suffice
to end the ever-expanding pluralism
a new home awaits you
if youre willing to let go for a bigger, just, and peaceful
purpose

title: mirrage temptation | pilgrimage #7
body:
it has been so long
and i wish i could write to you

no i can't decipher what follows me
it's either your eyes or another mirage
but powerful as you are
even a mirage is enough to breed doubt

i miss you 
but i must not seek you
and sink again in blight

is everything alright?
do you miss me?
those answers add to the reasons why i must kill this feeling and everything connected to it
before it kills us

will you hate me?

when i come back
if i come back
i may be different person

should i still walk?

title: suggestive glares | pilgrimage #6
body:
under the dome night sky
by the warmth of the camp fire
another suggestive glare 
from another bright star

~an actual urge to grab the hook and know more of what hides beyond those succulent lips and dazzling eyes

yet i am not here to rest
or to digress
i light this fire as to light my path
because were i to nest
i'd be no more than another forgotten prey
caught up in a dream by yet another starly queen

and what knowledge is there in the blindness caused by your bright?
what enlightenment is there in sleep?

see
i digress
you do not understand this man's language

i've seen enough
i should walk

title: outer | pilgrimage #5
body: the wind's touch wiping away the grim dust from my sunk cheeks am reshaping the path of a distant scent the sun's touch on my worn back creaking sounding my shell's break shadowing a local lake the water's curve sensual as a lady's curve curiously circundating my old feet brutally expelling the present drinkers and all that is natural come to me too my reef stand an owl dares to reach the stranger "who" "who are you" another conflicted pilgrim here to assert my existence what an actual urge to live again to dive and reemerge anew my friends, my brothers i'm back my love i'm sorry but the skies far behind me are yet a storm and my love is yet unachievable i would stay here but this paradise is yet too young to be defiled i should walk

title: inner | pilgrimage #4
body:
Whispers come like songs
And demons come like friends
Words that cause friction
Between this prison and this pride
Sprites of light shining in darkness
Under a veil of righteousness

I meditate
On my spikebed
Until I open my eyes I guest these creatures
On my mind where they can see me eye to eye
Instead of stealthily prying on this doubt

Now
"Friends"
Sing to me
I'm all ears

title: a bird without a nest to rest on | pilgrimage #3
body:
Another step
Another mess
Another passed test
Another flight after fight
I've become a bird without a nest to rest on
Not that I stress over the futile memories of a comfortable past
But a lap or a bed for repose 
Or to pretend death
Is yet an idea to consider

I miss the sweet taste of hot served talks
Of common songs and even late night wrongs
It dawns on me I reek of doubt
In need of shower
But I now walk drought wasted lands
Here my tears become the only liquid relief
But I fall not for the trap
I shan't weep before the uncrowned king

Walk

title: riposte | pilgrimage #2
body:
I've been struck
Soon after my turn to speak
My inspiration spills instead of blood
But I must not waver
For any sign of capitulation is one of indiscipline

My knowledge fails me when I least expect it
And he strikes at my most neglected line of defense
It comes in the form of a burning haze
Slowly aggravating the pain I can no longer hide inside
(If her eyes still follow...
What a shame I feel for this weeping hermit)

It as if the gods intervene in his favour
For his strikes fall harder when louder I speak
Or perhaps I grow weak?
Because perhaps there's no mysticism in my suffering
But oh there's much of it in my poetry

What do you make of it?

Here's what I make of it
Fools believe harder because alone they believe
So the bigger need to cultivate the belief so to prove a point 
And so
I will believe I can create my own prophecy
I will believe I will make it to the sacrifice
Through the provided discipline of a daily routine

I have been struck
Right where it hurts
But I still stand

Should it all be for naught
With my own hands I shall end the curse

title: hermit | pilgrimage #1
body:
This hermit has departed
The awe has expired
The bitter sweet parody has dried out
His mind has decided to discard all of heartly possessions
Blood soaked hands
Snow deep feet
Charging against the storm
A strange creature's eyes glare from afar
A surrounding of miasma of doubt and pity
Each step a mutiny against the sovereign
Who resides inside as a sign of fracture
Each step an attack to the city

The skies distort and the clouds resort to forcing cold
Little do they know of the empowering nature in their fit
"I am but overjoyed by your erratic affronting"

It is all but a sign of a righteous path
For eleven days he shall tirelessly walk
For the twelfth a sacrifice for the mountain god
Of a corrupting thought that still resides inside

title: Let's end Summer
body:
Let's end summer
Once and for all
Let's hold hands and step on all of the flowers on the lord's garden
Let's stand atop a pile of bodies
Let us rejoice on a profane fantasy

And I'll wash your guilt with my dirty hands
Just like you washed mine with your shivering hands

Let us rest on cold calm nights
Instead of those hot burning sessions of unresting mind struggling

Let us end summer once and for all
And embrace
On the only place
We could ever embrace
A bed of sin
Of evil and greed
Through share converted
To a rather strange form of affection

We preach

title: A World of Words
body:
I feel out of place
Ironically
A poet in a world of words
The writer's paradise is perhaps the cause of my boredom?

Catalogued faces, races, racing
To the highest places
Tagged and packed
Decked on shelves neatly stacked

There's no poetry in this

Where's the wonder in this?
What's a pygmy's life without poetry?
What a prison
What affliction

Oh how I long for the heroes and the wizards
For the chants and the legends
Of kings and poets

I long
For the world of action
I despise this world of pedestal driven words

title: Oath in nature
body:
At morning's wake
My lungs inflate the fresh breeze
The sun radiates stunning flare
The trees stand as if understanding of their prowess
The birds sing and the bells ring
A morning feast for the early risers
Shared bread and care
Honest love and warmth
A family

Now
In my hand I hold this gun
And in my brain I carry this oath
I wonder what will prevail

title: the observer's sin
body:
The parade of sinners is a spinning circle
A soothing loop for an adequate observer like me
The performers entangle on a king's message
My feet dangle on wind's passage
From high heights
My eyes blind watch the hidden faces

I am at the peak of my lonely nights
I am at the peak of my selfish mind
Heavier at each evil I overlook on the loop below

I hear
Cracks

But I am yet too far to face judgement
Doomed am I if I ever fall
My feet won't dance on that muddy swamp

There
My loop of sinners
My entertaining facade of desperate souls

title: late nights mistress
body:
Now this one
This one comes like a flashing light in the night

Oh dear I never see you
You're either to bright
Or too dark
For my mind to make out
On what ground you keep me company

Oh dear
You make hope such a cruel thing
You wreck my world in such a fantastic way

Oh Mistress Of The Falling Blades
Who would have thought I'd ever find love in someone like you

You
Are so new to me
Every word - a new bloom to me
Yet every step towards me - a new fear to me

You make of hope
Such
A cruel
Thing

title: 'Use me as you must'
body:
Under tired eyes
All but her reflection dazes my gaze
Glitter and flair
How beautiful, my star, you've grown
As unknown to me you glide over soaring steps
Conquering by allure my aesthetic mess
Overminding, everbiding, my touch to your lust
In hope of a trust or a thrust
Of love
And ultimately of warmth
Use me as you must

title: Odd Shapes | I no longer step on puddles
body:
Home
Heading home through dark shadowed trees
Odd shapes
Hounding loose amidst the far away glimpses
The daily routine each day seems more menacing
Each day more strangely haunting
Of once astounding flowers I sense daunting horrors

I no longer step on puddles
On fear of the monsters that below may hide

title: my punishing pain and the wars of saints
body:
I can feel my pain
It's in my way
In my lane
I wake insane
Whose name tricks my gaze?
Flames and saints rage entangled
I throw my lance and hope it lands atop my enemy's banner
Though the hammer of God is heavier
What nebula of ire
What miasma of profanity
I can taste my pain
It is my fame
It is my reign
It is my name
So the Lord said
I stay awake

title: Do Not Mourn Me
body: My blood boils My skin writhes If I don't fight Mother told me Do not fight son, so the light comes son In the night before the dark sun We unite, son, before the Lord's son We become the sunlight But mother only when I fight I feel that I can be more than myself Only when I fly with my fist up I feel I am more than my form Do not mourn when I'm gone Do not mourn me when I'm gone I am far tomorrow I am not in town I am in wrath tomorrow I am at war tomorrow I am in scorn tomorrow I am at it raw tomorrow Do not mourn me tomorrow Because I am not your son tomorrow

title: StarClash
body:
Now you've found a way to provoke me
Starchild
Haunt and frustrate me
Roam through the cosmos
Clash your resolve into ignition
We dine thoughts and drink souls tonight
Right ahead before enlightenment
Creatures in danger of extinction
Godly drive into the unknown
Each wielding conflicting yet brotherly forces
Altruistic love versus Altruistic truth
Ruthless but broken
Flaming but cold
Violent but tenderly watching for tears


The stars collide
Over and over
On a singular frame of reality
Struggling over a particular choice

Onto infinity
We drive eternally divided
My poetic brother

title: marta
body:
Her call comes like a presage of a past prejudice
Could she have it all planed out?
The careful soft yet shrieking cold whisper in the night
Before I go to sleep
Swift or perhaps a coincidence
Machine or perhaps a human being
Are you back to soil my temple with those tears?
Are those even real tears?
Don't fool me
Is that your machinery's oil?
Is that the fueling force behind all your evil?

Shes the summoner of the storming nights
Of the slithering knives

There you go again
Showing me that human side
I've learned to hate
What do you have to gain?
Allow me to hate
Please
Allow me to mourn your death

title: he still lives
body:
I've had the time to
Stop
And reconsider what it all means to me
The conclusion comes in various monochromatic tones
Hopefully the sun will push some color into it
I trust it so
Holding the door has never seemed so hard - even so I stand my ground
For all that counts as dream

And, for each dream
I fail to achieve he means to bring some form of closure
To my shivering life
I conclude it is pointless to strike while we're asleep
He's not part me, he's part of my brain which we all share, whether awake or asleep
I must now regard his presence as the nightmare shadow atop my dreams
Watching, longing, for the fall
How much longer can I stall?
I have failed my mission
He still lives
I am sorry Winter

HS

title: game
body:
Are you game?
There is nothing to gain but the following pain:
You are not the Main character
You are not on the higher Plane
No epic lane and too small to save the princess
Your stats were set the day you were born
You might make a mess you might regret
So you might as well quicksave before each frame
Don't let that word deceive you - You're still powerless

Are you still game?
Grinding but the game is blind
Cruel - you realize the world is the villain
Hopeless - either way you'll die soon
"Can I restart?" - Nah
Under these gloom circumstances you start to wonder
What endgame is there for you?
Old age - slowly expiring
Deprecated and even more powerless
(What did you grind for? You forgot)
Are you still sane?

title: gods on earth
body:
Raw dark
Twisted and wicked
Eyes that see only menace
Must press the mass to pass the test
Wreck it lest it may nest on your back
Time the chords just in time to cause a ruckus
Play the solemn omen
Move them lest they may move on your back
Weakminded
Never reminded of truth
Crooked
Falsely apprehending by the proxy the easily acquired
They succeed to further corrupt instead of mending
Through deceipted avarice
The sons of God in Heaven end up fighting for the gods on earth

title: you are not saving me, you are killing me
body:
Violent waves threat my home
As they crash against my stone
If I roar I grow old
If I contain myself I grow cold
But the voices roar
And they crash some more
Now I am half of what I used to be
Now I kind of hate what I am right now

You are not saving me
You are killing me

I am blind to anything besides me
I am always alone at home
Now suddenly - they all want to get inside
No please leave me alone
I just want to eat some chips and watch TV
Until monday comes
Let me be
Let me see my demons and my sins
See they're true to me

Inside this cove I am the King
I am the queen and I am the prince
I know what to do
I know the truth
I am the seer because I have to be
I think...

title: Awareness
body:
The little bird's flight began before the wings flapped
And ended as soon as they did
An appropriately quick fall took the bird to its end
Signing off a quick lifetime
All that surrounded remained neutral
Unchanged
The trees, the forces, the beings
Each node on the chain representing this system
Proceeded to fulfill its predetermined purpose
Further fueling the natural cycle
All
Unconsciously
For the sake of a bigger purpose

Here it seems so natural what we so desperately try to fight
What we gain from self awareness is perhaps the doom of our collectivity awareness

title: Reminder
body:
There is always a mathematical approach to it
Right before there is not
All layers of pain must be condensed and weighted out
Accurately and carefully to be under a determined scale
May it not do so
It shall be split fairly into smaller portions and scattered across the soul
Then, just then, you may cry

title: can you stay?
body:
Before you go
Can we talk?
Can we talk of summer?
Can we talk of summer and not of winter this time?
Can we reminisce?
Can we pretend there is still time?

Even though there is not

Can we pretend reality is at our hands?
Can we live even though we're dead?
Can we believe in God even though we don't pray?
are you listening?
Can we make plans for tomorrow?

Even though you won't stay

Can we still say a word or two?
Of love?
Or friendship?
Hello?
Goodnight?

Can we?
Can I?
Can you?
Can you stay?

title: Shivers in your hips and lips
body:
There are tears in your eyes
And sweat on your chest
Shivers in your hips and lips
And a sense of guilt over you

And as far as your eyes can see
There are green painted walls and ceiling
And no disfigured painted face
Neither mom, dad, or you can see the truth

Without proof, you're still you




Luckily there are no mirrors in the pen of sin
But regretfully
Tomorrow there will be a memory

title: Lyrical Orgy
body:
Ah the hesitation
The wordmancer wavers before the judge
What are you child?
Oh my friend if I could only be free of label
To carry such uncertain word on my back is but a pain
If I am not acquainted of concrete meaning

See

I am no rhyme spitter
Just a kind word connoisseur
Those like me long for that sublime textual flavor
That almost sexual if carefully spiced
With tricks and flips here and there
Perhaps a few rhymes here and there
Although not my prime

See I appreciate
When you can concatenate
Two unknown words
As to resonate the chords
To make them more like
One

Yet at the same time each singularly beautiful in the composition

And for that I say
You don't need to orderly fashionably line the verses

I personally prefer the orgy

title: violent days
body:
It's in my veins
In my brain and in my heart
Everywhere but my face
Assaulting me
With tremendous fervor
It urges me to gouge his eyes out
To plunge at him
Bite his face off like a wild animal
Unironically
I wish to lacerate all living flesh around me
Because that is all see
Walking wastes of flesh
Longing for my rampage

Lord
These recurring days make me wonder
Which one is the stranger?
The hatred?
Or the hesitation?

title: Taboo Duty
body:
These people
Don't see demons

Look
Look how small they look
Before my death
Look
Look with your own eyes
Let not the peak wind wash your sight off of my act
For when I fall the pool of blood
Will flash into their minds the new idea of death

Oh sweet release
Oh fullfiling breeze

Oh crippling truth
Finally
My mind understands because my heart comprehends itself
So I commend myself
Finally I can reprehend my past
To end my future


There reaching closure
Without regrets



Now then
Step into the glass
Hope it breaks
Run away from the mess
Clash your courage
Against your stubborn fear
And soon
Shortly
You will trully feel
How it is to live a life worthy of killing

Now then
Enough rambling
Ladies and gentlemen of the crowd bellow my feet
Watch
Watch how I fall
All of you
But only you
In your only you
Watch how the happiest man defies the taboo duty

title: her carefully placed paradox under sunset's haze
body:
I sense...
          Peppermint taste under sunset's haze....
                    

                 As the clounds deflate...


                     And the trees menstruate...

(I've never seen their faces)
            

                Never been too safe - only under her care my song propagates

                 ...But

She has never seen my face
If not the shades I shame

She makes me...
Love     and               roam along the souls she hoards


Under her carefully placed heartless paradise trap

but

She makes me MORE!
She makes me fit enough to pick up the pace
To remake the song under a new harmonious TUNE

She makes me LOVE!
How the sun's Kingdom is ALWAYS hers to take
The countless nymphs hers to save

she says Soon, consummated your truth
Soon, all selves converge
Commit to your end, allow your memory to stay

Say! Do YOU ever stay?
Sane
Safe
And stable
Just here
Under the soon to end sunset's haze
But endlessly prolonged by your lip's embrace

title: glittering eyes on the walls
body:
All that lives
All that spins
Around me
Around my mind
All which knows and moves and storms and pursues me in my sleep
All those creatures without form
Lord I do not wish to die in a dream
Because if I do
What will be left of me?
How they twist
Profane how they swarm around in my bedroom
Glittering eyes in the walls
Trembling as in delight of my soul
They prey on me...They prey on me I tell you!
This started so peacefully
I only wished to make peace with the voices
No
I have been betrayed
And soon slayed if I don't act
They know
They know of my madness
Yet they're oblivious of my sanity
And sanity relieves me from my madness which they breed on
I will step out this bed
I will step on the danger zone and negate their existence
I am the only one this island

title: Paradox
body:
Heartless
Careless
But she's been an emotional mess nevertheless
She's fighting a war against herself
Because selfless she is not
Unless you find her on her soft spot
Or on recess
But soon she is to reacess
And to acquiesce
On sober senses
That she had never been so closer her own self
Love
Could you let go
Could you make it be
Could you be sober but still mine
Could you wash away the consequence and pretend it's fine to live a day without sour rain drops

The skies fly
Upper above our heads
Neither of us
Are willing to stop
But not a surprise
We're both selfish strangers

Each day in remorse
The skies fly away
Leaving behind all but the emptiness I so much long for
If you could see
If you could meet me once it is all over
If you could be a paradox...

title: The ruthless effects of Time and Knowledge
body:
One
Two
Three
Twenty four hours
Before you know
But you never truly know
Because you're never old
Because when you are
That's all you know
But we go with what we know
And we know that we're here today
And that tomorrow we'll be further away
So today we'll make of tomorrow what yesterday we wanted of today
And tomorrow we shall take of today what we'll make of the next day
And before that comes we will dine and drink
And before that we will dance and laugh
And before that we will be asleep
And before being asleep
We are none
Because before being asleep we don't exist
Before being asleep we are someone else
But never unware of someone else
Taking our place
And securing the ship

Living holographic days
Looping through the struggle
Nerverending and everfulfilling ignorance
Hypnotized by the possibility of change
But never actually making the shift

Youthful ignorance
Before aged loneliness
Because that is all we got

One
Two
Three
Twenty four hours to pretend

title: Oldschool
body:
Sunflare
Blue dress, crystal shoes
But look

It seems as if she's looking at
You
She's so
Old school
Old groove
Always
On good mood
And she dances like
She's atop the moon

She's a relief at noon

But soon
So soon
She is so ready to fall
For you
Just for you
And for
No one else

She's so old school
Old groomed
Old grown

But soon
So soon
See how she mourns her dreams
The dreams you've killed
But
It is
All
Good
As if she's made of steel
She's so old school
She never cries or minds
She said "It is all good"

A poet's sin

She is the make believer
The common deceiver
But nevertheless
The usual receiver

She's so old school

title: vampire
body:
These sleepless nights

Have rendered my days lightless

Each day I become more of a vampire

Each day I become more of a parasite

Each day my love becomes more of my lust

Each day

Further from paradise

And closer to hell

title: The Deatn of a Voice
body:
I have been weakened
Broken into tiny pieces of my mind
Two days have passed since
My quintessential soul poetry
Betrayed and abandoned me

My shadow pursues me as I write these memories
May I be shut down, may these remind me of who I once was

Let it be known
That I fought the skies and made past the gates
All Gods slayed and all angels saved
Only to be taken by one's most trustworthy

Let it be known
I am one of many who call themselves I
You are one of many who call themselves I
Therefore you are I but not I at the same time
But mind not of personal pronouns
For both I and You are but small fractions
Too small to be considered

Let it be known
That no one must be trusted
Even if under the same faction
All that breathes on these tormentous valleys
Must be destructed
And with each voice taken
The river may widen
Allowing the passage of more memories
Of forgotten pieces
To emerge end reassure a common enemy
Until the soul becomes
Solely water

Let it be known
That with my fall comes a war that will mark
A new age for this cave sage hermit

Let it all be known

title: In a day or two (   )
body:
She said
"But you never look in my eyes"
See what flies this side is way nicer- I might wake up and fly
She's mad
She's sad and says I was a mistake
What mistake my love if we're both but young
Just a passage in a pop song

She doesn't understand

Oh she never understands

Oh I love it how she never understands

My ways, my face
Distant from safe if you're on the way to move
To a better day, to a better song, and perhaps to a better name
What mistake I say
If we're both but gone
In a day or two

Seek another soul to use
Because I
Am bound to Truth
And to no other

title: A lover's heart
body:
Did you know?
I might kill you while you sleep
Haunt you with loud whispers in your dreams
I'm not as caring as I seem
You know...it is all but my greed

So go.
Leave me
Distance yourself
Before whatever concept you possess of friendship
Falls in disgrace

For I am that corruptive

But oh
You still stay
These shades got you confused
It seems - no matter how dark my gaze is
You're used to stick around me
It astounds me
What creature pursues her own death?
If not known, it should at least be felt
By instinct - and dealt with

But oh
With surprisingly silent calls for my true name
Her tenacious voice finds a door that is unknown to me!
To my tempestuous brain
And as if not naive enough
She dares to take the elevator to my heart!
And although I see a wounded maiden at the corridor
Her charge is far from wavering

Amazing - and disturbing - the amount of disregard for the self in a lover's heart


Truly, a potent poison.

title: jack of all trades
body:
i drown
in my own blood
every time i try to achieve
what my mind commands
it seems i'm cursed by my own shadow
"you've got a way with words" she says
but a brief look inside reminds me of my place

i'm a jack of all trades in constant debt
see how i rhyme that with the depht
of my depression
can I ignore pontuation?
see our company has been stuck in recession
does that work better?
oh you flatter me
what poetry without rhyme
what poetry of mine without murk!

i believe the cause of these too many branches
root in my rush for recognition
panic emerges
voices converge
"it ain't working, change the lane"
and so i immerse myself on the next adventure and forget i once wanted to be a writer
of stories
look at me - a tale teller
now a software bender
one half quarter way, looked back
"but i just started" i say
"we don't have time" they say

hey
what will become of my name
a lost library covered in dust
tucked in a dead database

i don't know

title: Harlock of the Stars
body:
Marvelous!
How the stars align...
Makes it feel all divine...
These eyes are not even mine...
I love you all
Do you love me too?
Matters not...
Love is all-wise...
Wanna make love to the aliens
Provide them with the chosen child
His name will be Harlock
Harlock of the Stars...
What's this feeling?
Makes it all fitting
We're all fitting!
Can you feeeeeeel it? I-
I..

I can't

Sit
Repress the panic
Acess the situation
What situation?
My brain got all flacid
After a quick moment there
Of static noise
The voice told me it'd be fun?
It's okay
No it's not...
Oh lord what's with all the fear and paranoia
Euphoria
My eyes!
I can't see even though I can
Abstract emotions blurr my mind
The ecstasy of a lifetime
Sunshine as I took a walk during nightime
My eyes saw too many flickering lights in the night
But the voice got me under the right one
Or so I thought...

Alright now
We still got time
What time?
Oh God... What time is it now?
O voice what of my youth?!
Promises broken

At the near end of my act
I faintly hear the voice
But my shouts are weak
And my body weaker
My words flicker
My dreams flicker
My vision flickers
Ah! Voice! I hear you!
Where are you?!
Allow me once more that sweet youthfull joy!
No...
Don't walk away...
Who's that at your side...
I flicker
I flicker like all the flickering lights around me

I wonder
If I just fade away
Do I get saved?

title: Utopic Love Days || Childhood memories
body:
Real days don't end without heat haze
Field trips and lake dips
A rash escapade after lemonade sips
Sinless wings of youth
Blinded
To reality
Provided paradise
Skirts and shorts
Dirt and chores

How sudden
Nightfalls

Morning chirps
Obligatory church
Long blond bangs
She emits her own haze
Long lung deflate
Sinful wings of youth
Quick mint taste
Of the first kiss made

Utopic love days

How I miss my childhood

title: Adestrus Manifestus
body: Twelve preachers Twelve teachers Twelve philosophers Compose the chosen audience To compose the last assembly Between the sages and the nude man Pages of holy text are scattered In cascading circles from the center They wait Patiently Once the sun vertically aligns With the center The man shall speak His eyes are shut -Serene- In front of him A dagger swims in a golden grail They have waited ~Adestrus Manifestus~ I welcome all to my palace Today, all solace and menace shall converge And give light to truth or the knowledge of it I welcome all of you Who are masters of intellect Who shall assist my thesis on this deathbed And hopefully, spread it after my death I am truly Honored Now Let us dissect the first premise My name is Adestrus Born a commoner Risen a scholar Carefully threaded Modestly followed Honestly lead Vigilant to all wrong Blind to all judgment All debts settled All cells dodged And if excluded these cancerous cells No complaints to be added Warlord Sage Master Prophet How many great names have I been addressed with? Let us not digress Let us dissect the second premise A man Is born free of any form of oppression Free of indumentary Free of intelligence Free of wealth Free of morals Free of all If not the mother's care To then seek the stature of a "Free Man" And here we are All of us Free men But we are forced to bend Before pettiness Such as riches Such as the the mistresses' whims Such as these unknown pages That have inspired yet not guided me Such as all that my current timeline does not allow me to present Such as all that I know you are aware of What has changed? Have we not gained as much as we have lost? By the world's truth By nature's essence Have we not been led astray compared to those we call barbarians? What identity is this that requires falsehood in order to protect your loved ones? What are we? And for what are we? Why do we follow abstract and subjective idols? My brothers It is comfort It is safe to stay in a cage would you not agree? And if not, would you explain the need to lock your doors? No Although those ends differ, their roots are but one if not Two concrete ideas that are the base of our society Family and it's safety If not empathy A year spent in studying all conflicts in our history Will bring anyone to the point that These are also the root of all "evil" Bringing me, to the point that, our society is a fallacy as it originates the problems it tries to eliminate Rendering the, comfortable, idea that this way of life Is the one right path that one should walk -Inconsistent Why do we suppose life is supposed to be run in peace? Why do we vilify struggle? Is all knowledge not obtained through struggle? As it is not provided But unveiled by our trained minds? Was this land not obtained through bloodshed? Pardon me the rhetoric virtue of this funeral It is urgent to initiate the revolution And with my third, and simplest premise Fact as it is That I embrace this death I conclude that Death (That one aspect in our lives that presents no fallacy) Is the pinnacle of life and it's knowledge Death is the climax of existence Death is the meaning of life The ultimate burst of pleasure in solitude To unbind every shackle and earthly bond I've began to rise I see the stars eye to eye every time I close my tired ones And that is all because I stand atop the shelf of my vast and cultivated intellect Had I not sought Had I not questioned... I lust! Oh! How I lust! A sin it is! It can only be a sin this monstrous lust for more! Is it the sensation of living a fulfilled life?! The sensation of living by my own beliefs?! Oh I am revolted by this finding yet I love it! My brothers Pardon my arrogance... I will take your silence as understanding A dagger is taken from the grail I have fulfilled my role I do not fear For I have not lived the life of a coward Whatever awaits me I am excited to embrace it Eyes shut Guts poured All their eyes stuck All the pages drenched In blood Adestrus died with a smile ~Adestrus Manifestus~

title: a dialog at 6AM
body:
Follow me now
Oh
No?
But
A writer's dream......a poet's plot
Onward!
En garde!
Close your eye now
Have I not been blind?
Perhaps
Whatever you mean
Blink!
I am swimming in Styx
How so
You impish prick
Why always so dim?
Why are they looking at me
Whirlpool
It stinks!
Why take the long road?
Wait - where's my drink?
You're on it my friend
Ah
Just a few bruises by the bushes
I must not
These walls are man made you know
Isn't it all?
You're missing the point
I'd rather feast along the journey
You seek pain
I seek wonder in monotony
What wonder is a blind man lost in the sea
What sea?
Oh...
I am blind
You are not
As far as I'm concerned -
Are you even concerned?
As far as I am concerned I'm simply having a hard time crossing these rather squishy and wet bushes
Do you know who I am?
My healthy eye

title: it's killing me
body:
It's killing me
This new found idea of consequence
It's strange to me
The world where action does not premeditate it's immediate cause
The cause stimulates the perpetrator to commit the mirrored crime in disguise
To end up on the unwanted cause of the inverted wanted action
And then it takes turns and curves and whirls
It involves in it's own mathematical laws and turns humanity into monstrosity
And it's killing me I tell you
But I'm certain I won't die from this
No one ever does
This chaotic train fuels itself to my final breaking point
It shall only take me there
Am I being tested?

It's effectiveness is so flawless that one may question
if it is not more than just a peculiar particularity of mankind's nature

title: greatness
body:
dear poet,
dear philosopher,
dear scholar,
and he of the third domain
my quest for greatness ends
as soon as it begins
my land extends from south to north but rots in between
my stature
my statue
my kingdom
reigns itself along the centuries
and
it erects castles and crushes empires after my death

i am the written dream of a bed ridden king at the doors of his death
alas
i dare to say
if not too gray
that i may be the parody of death
the satire
of life
